summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Judge Richard M. Berman, formally notifying the court of Jeffrey Epstein's death by suicide in custody on August 10, 2019, and requesting the court approve an order of nolle prosequi to dismiss the criminal case against him. The letter also states the government's commitment to victims under the Crime Victims' Rights Act.

connections.description: Geoffrey S. Berman, as U.S. Attorney, was the lead prosecutor for the government in the criminal case against defendant Jeffrey Epstein.
Judge Richard M. Berman was the presiding judge over the criminal case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein in Custody
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner later determined the cause of death was hanging and the manner was suicide.

events.title: Medical Examiner's Statement on Epstein's Death
events.description: The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner of the City of New York issued a statement identifying the cause of Jeffrey Epstein's death as hanging and the manner as suicide.

events.title: Government Files for Nolle Prosequi
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office filed this letter with the court, formally notifying it of Epstein's death and requesting approval of an order of nolle prosequi to dismiss the criminal case.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died on the morning of August 10, 2019, while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner determined the cause of death was hanging and the manner was suicide, as stated on August 16, 2019.
Due to Epstein's death prior to a final conviction, the government requested the court approve an order of nolle prosequi to dismiss the criminal case.
The government states it has made efforts to contact all identified victims since learning of Epstein's death, in accordance with the Crime Victims' Rights Act.
The U.S. Attorney's Office publicly states its commitment to standing up for victims who have come forward and those who have yet to do so.
